headline: Tariff-Sensitive Stocks Apple and Nike Are Getting Clobbered. Time to Buy?
summary: Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) and Nike (NYSE: NKE) are down over 20% year to date at the time of this writing, significantly underperforming the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite, which are also down significantly.  China is a key market for Apple -- both from a manufacturing and a sales perspective.  After Apple stock surged on April 9 in response to a 90-day pause on reciprocal tariffs to all countries except China, it sank 4% the following day on news that the tariff rate on Chinese goods would be raised to a staggering 145%.
